website_summaries.verdict: The Optoma ML550 is about the size of earlier-generation 300-lumen WXGA (1,280-by-800) palmtop projectors, but offers a 500-lumen rating.
pros: Reads files from internal memory, microSD cards, and USB memory keys
LED light source claims 20,000 hour lifetime
cons: Shows scaling artifacts (unwanted patterns added to some screens) at its claimed native resolution

customer_reviews.title: Good for <100 inches but more likely 80"
customer_reviews.text: The processor in this is slow. SD-Card and internal memory playback (and even the memory scanning) is very poor and buggy using standard directory file structures on FAT32. You can't use the internal playback mode without embarrassingly slow / jittery and out of sync video play-back. Sound is better although you will need to you the multi-cable output to an amp and speakers to descent quality. The HDMI input is a MUCH better option, and the screen quality and contrast is surprisingly good for a unit of this type and size. However, I am sure you will find a better one at around £400. Thankfully, I only paid half of that.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Light and compact
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and light weight. No UK plug, some ridiculous large converter contraption to change to UK plug that makes the plug larger than the projector and therefore cannot fit in the carry bag, which is way too small to fit this in and a hdmi lead which sadly is not supplied either which I would expect at this price. The carry bag is not very well padded either: I assume Optoma are confident in the robustness of their product - time will tell. If you are selling a product in the UK then it should be fit for purpose in the UK. Petty penny pinching just takes the shine off what is an excellent mini projector.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, only let down is firmware
customer_reviews.text: Great picture for a projector of this size. Only let down is the fact the latest firmware is about 3 years out of date, therefore the version of Android it runs, plus the apps available are all very dated. Hadn't planned to use the smart function anyway, using a firestick, so all works well. Picture sharp and bright.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Great portable projector, fantastic resolution
customer_reviews.text: WOW this is a great little portable projector. I use it as I travel a lot and it was unfeasible to take a "normal" size one. I have used the sd card slot and the hdmi connection and both are great. I've used it approx 8 feet away from a white wall and the writing/pictures are crystal clear so much in fact that my colleagues have bought it as well.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a small presentation and it works much better than i had expected. Small, easy to use, bright so will become my projector of choice even for fairly large groups. Delivered on time too.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Portable and very efficient
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Image is very crisp and use is simple. But remember that the quality of the projector depends on how dark is the room. that's why cinemas do not have windows ;-). I would really recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality small projector
customer_reviews.text: A superb projector. Very small, lightweight and bright considering its size. The quality of the image is also superb and colours are good. Sound through its little speaker is not good, so always use another sound system with it.
customer_reviews.author: Markys Cain

customer_reviews.title: Great little piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Great little piece of kit. The fan is a wee bit noisy but not to the extent that it's distracting. I am using it mainly for gaming and it holds up pretty well to a much larger Optoma model I bought a few years back. Also great for taking to presentations for work. You can also plug into external speakers and gives out good sound.
customer_reviews.author: I. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Needs to have more lumins
customer_reviews.text: It’s great that’s it’s small and compact but it’s not bright enough
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a short time but now doesn't light up when switched on and will not switch off
customer_reviews.author: Harry Giles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING LITTLE PROJECTOR, WORKS WELL. ONLY USE IT FOR FOOTBALL , AND MOVIES AT NIGHT VERY PLEASED
customer_reviews.author: Orc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A quality bit of kit and has served me well!
customer_reviews.author: Daryl A. Littlejohns

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent projector, can't believe how small it is. Have used it on shelf behind my bed, resulting in a 90 inch 16:9 'screen' on the wall opposite. Depends on room size, and my room isn't very big. I've connected Chromecast up to the back of it and stream netflix from my phone or tablet. Fan obviously makes a little noise, but it's OK. I use small stereo speakers on bedside cabinets or connect headphones. Pretty bright image, but obviously works better in dark rooms. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Great little piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful piece of kit. Compact, effective and works well from external sources and internal card reader. Setup using wireless dongle was a little fiddly, but as expected from research prior to purchase; not sufficient to detract from overall rating
customer_reviews.author: iaincatt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Projection Capability
customer_reviews.text: An incredible piece of kit. The projection from a very short distance is amazing. Easy to set up to control from my iPad. It is soooo tiny!! May need to get another for our CEO.
customer_reviews.author: Paddyk

customer_reviews.title: It is brilliant for professional presentations
customer_reviews.text: This is not a cheap mini projector but it has been worth every penny. It is brilliant for professional presentations, super easy to use, quick to set up and it is light and super portable.It has crisp sharp images and copes well with day time light levels (with the exception of strong/direct sunlight). We also get great home use from it for movie nights. Top quality, sharp images projected onto a pale wall that are 2m wide. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the picture quality is really good however it is a little bit hassle to connect ...
customer_reviews.text: the picture quality is really good however it is a little bit hassle to connect speakers and built-in speaker is not good enough for watching films etc.
customer_reviews.author: Taylan

customer_reviews.title: I love the projector
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time. I love the projector, it's very light and high quality picture
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Candelario

customer_reviews.title: It is a bit noisy and not enough lumens for ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit noisy and not enough lumens for day screening. It was sent with european plug - so I had to use a UK adaptor.
customer_reviews.author: ines

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great picture for size over short throw. Not that easy to set up initially. Comes with a serial cable......Really?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Colin Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I use it all the time in rounds.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B.

customer_reviews.title: Small and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is incredibly small and powerful projector, it really does fit in the palm of your hand! Image is surprisingly bright, but best when the room is is reasonably dark. It coped well with movies and games (GTA4, wokfenstein and COD). The screen size can be stretched to 100 inch at a push, but 80 is probably best. The speakers are very weak, connecting an external speaker is a bit of a faff as you need to use a multipurpose cable, it is a shame it does not have Bluetooth connectivity as standard, I hate cables trailing all over the place. This absolutely perfect as a travel projector, it kept the kids really happy on holidays
customer_reviews.author: Barbeche

customer_reviews.title: Excellent projector and also Optoma cutomer service
customer_reviews.text: Already posted an extensive comment so can't fathom why this request appeared? Suffice to say the surprisingly minuscule ML750e has served me extremely well with my first fine art project; the purpose for my acquisition. I am sure it will continue to do so. Optoma support over a warranty issue was excellent. Almost purchased the Artograph Flare, at a higher price, an item that is supposedly geared for art usage. So pleased I went to Optoma.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. Dore

customer_reviews.title: it becomes wonderfully simple in terms of set up
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed by this projector. It's tiny, it's bright, and if you pair it with a standard tripod, it becomes wonderfully simple in terms of set up, even if you have to move it round your house a lot. Only downside is the focusing can be a bit uneven and fade off towards the edges. When you're watching a movie, this isn't really a problem, if you use this projector as a computer monitor for lots of text, then you're better off with a screen, or a more expensive projector.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Pictures not showing
customer_reviews.text: I give slideshows and need them to work. However with this projector, every so often a photo is missing, in Powerpoint, with the writing still there. No obvious reason, photos of the same size. Random as far as I can see. The same presentation (USB) works fine on my old Optoma 300 projector which has been great, except for issues with the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Dowding

customer_reviews.title: Cracking little projector, you'll be very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Superb little projector, been watching Star Wars on an 8ft wide screen :-). As stated in another review, getting the best focus does take a bit of fiddling, but not too bad. Excellent quality image for something this size. Have yet to try the 3d, so will write another review once I've tried it. This has really turned me onto projectors; you won't be disappointed with your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: robert grosvenor

customer_reviews.title: A great unit for its compact size but it isn't capable ...
customer_reviews.text: A great unit for its compact size but it isn't capable of displaying a true 1080p image as its native resolution is 1280x800, where as 1080p would require 1920x1080 resolution. The firmware isn't all that great, but what do you expect from something do small.
customer_reviews.author: Mr L Miller

product_meta.title: Optoma ML750e WXGA Ultra-portable lightweight LED Home Cinema Projector Optoma ML750e WXGA makes it the ideal
product_meta.description:
Style Name:700 Lumens

TheUltra lightweightOptoma ML750e WXGA makes it the ideal portable solution for your projector needs. The ML750e incorporates a media player, native office viewer and built-in speaker. The Native Office Viewer recognises and plays videos, photos, Microsoft Office and Adobe PDF files. The ML750e harnesses the latest LED technology. This eliminates the need for lamp replacements, saving you both time and money and gives you an exceptional life-span for the projector of 20,000 hours.



BOX CONTAINS
AC Power Cord
Battery
carry bag
HDMI Cable
Quick start guide
Remote Control
feature_bullets: Projection technology: DLP, Projector native resolution: WXGA (1280x800), Screen size compatibility: 17 - 100"
Service life of lamp: 20000 h, Lamp type: LED. Offset: 100%, Throw ratio: 1.5:1
Supported graphics resolutions: 1024 x 768 (XGA), 800 x 600 (SVGA), Supported video modes: 1080i, 480i, 480p, 576i, 576p, 720p. USB connector type: USB Type-A
MHL support, HDMI connectivity, Built in speaker, 3D Ready
Includes 2 year UK warranty on the projector and 5 year/12,000 hrs warranty on the light source

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
